title: Man City vs Watford LIVE: Stream, score, goals and latest updates from the Premier League
text:
Follow live updates as Manchester City look to get their title defence back on track against Watford.

City slipped up last week, losing 3-2 at Norwich to fall five points behind early frontrunners Liverpool, and Pep Guardiola will know that he cannot afford another mistake this week even this early in the season.

For Watford there is plenty of work to do for returning manager Quique Sanchez Flores, with Watford bottom of the table, but he at least made a promising start with a 2-2 draw against Arsenal last week. Follow all the action live:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Key Points Goal updates from Burnley vs Norwich and Everton vs Sheffield Utd

Man City XI: Ederson; Walker, Fernandinho, Otamendi, Mendy; Rodri, David Silva, De Bruyne; Mahrez, Bernardo, Agüero.

Watford XI: Foster; Foulquier, Mariappa, Dawson, Holebas; Femenía, Doucouré, Capoue, Cleverley, Hughes; Deulofeu.

HALF TIME Man City 5 - 0 Watford 45+3 mins: A magnificent half for Manchester City where they scored five goals in 18 minutes. The highest Premier League scoreline was a 9-0 victory for Manchester United against Ipswich in 1995. Man City have a great chance to better that in the second half. Man City 5 - 0 Watford 44 mins: Two dangerous crosses from Manchester City cause more problems for Watford. De Bruyne with a cross from the right finds Aguero who hits the post with a header. The ball comes out to Mahrez who puts it back in and picks out Bernardo Silva who heads over the bar. Three added minutes at the end of this first half. GOAL! Everton 0 - 1 Sheffield Utd - Mina (OG) 40 mins: GOAL! Sheffield Utd have the lead at Goodison Park. A corner ball comes in for United and Pickford misses the ball, it hits Mina on the shoulder and goes into the back of the net. Man City 5 - 0 Watford 39 mins: De Bruyne heads the corner ball away and Man City threaten to break on the counter attack. City win a throw in in opposition's half. Advertisement Man City 5 - 0 Watford 36 mins: A quieter period of play as Watford recover from their bamboozling start. Deulofeu gets into the penalty and Watford win a corner courtesy of Pereyra. Man City 5 - 0 Watford 33 mins: Watford make their first substitution as Pereyra comes on for Foulquier. Meanwhile Man City's five goals in 18 minutes is a Premier League record: Man City 5 - 0 Watford 30 mins: Sergio Aguero gets another chance but hits the post. Pep Guardiola is shaking his head on the sidelines. Man City have scored five but they've missed their last two chances and Pep isn't happy about that. Aguero gives the ball to David Silva who shoots from 18-yard away and has his shot blocked. The Man City players all fancy a goal today. Man City 5 - 0 Watford 27 mins: It was almost six for Man City! A great ball from De Bruyne in midfield catches Aguero free past the Watford defence. Foster is in no man's land between his 18-yard and six-yard boxes. Aguero knocks it past him but misses the goal! Advertisement Man City 5 - 0 Watford 24 mins: Another corner is whipped in from De Bruyne to the six yard box. Watford's defenders scramble and eventually boot the ball away to Ederson in Man City's goal. Man City 5 - 0 Watford 21 mins: Watford have a free kick of their own hat they play into the box but the whistle goes as someone drifts offside. It must be a demoralising day for them. GOAL! Man City 5 - 0 Watford - Otamendi 18 mins: GOAL! Another set piece is taken quickly by David Silva. Aguero runs into the left channel and whips the ball across goal with Otamendi running on to the ball to tap it in to the open net. Five goals with five different scorers. GOAL! Burnley 2 - 0 Norwich - Wood 14 mins: GOAL! Chris Wood doubles his tally and that Burnley at Turf Moor. Dwight McNeil crosses the ball into the box and finds Wood who shoots with his left foot and scores! Advertisement GOAL! Man City 4 - 0 Watford - Bernardo Silva 15 mins: GOAL! De Bruyne wins a corner and delivers it into the box. Otamendi flicks it on and Bernardo Silva heads it past Foster. This is insane, I can't type quickly enough. GOAL! Man City 3 - 0 Watford - Mahrez 12 mins: GOAL! Mahrez was brought down on the edge of the 18-yard box and he wins a free kick for City. De Bruyne and Mahrez himself stand over the ball, Mahrez takes the shot, it gets a big deflection off the wall and finds the back of the net. GOAL! Burnley 1 - 0 Norwich - Wood 10 mins: GOAL! Over in the match between Burnley and Norwich the home side take the lead with Chris Wood meeting a corner ball and heading home. Man City 2 - 0 Watford 10 mins: Ten minutes gone at the Etihad and it's game over already for Watford. The only question now remains how many will Man City score? I went for 4-0 before the start of play but the speed at which Man City have come out of the blocks mean it could be more. Advertisement GOAL! Man City 2 - 0 Watford - Aguero 7 mins: GOAL! Man City break on the counter attack with De Bruyne on the ball. He gives the ball to Mahrez who is brought down by Foster for a penalty. Aguero steps up and slots it into the middle of the net. Man City 1 - 0 Watford Penalty to Man City! Man City 1 - 0 Watford 4 mins: What a start for Manchester City. It was their first attack and the Watford defence was all at sea. A mistake at the back for the champions almost lets Deulofeu in, he takes the ball past Otamendi and shoots, getting a deflection over the bar to win a corner. GOAL! Man City 1 - 0 Watford - David Silva Kick off: The match gets underway at the Etihad stadium. De Bruyne crosses the ball from the right hand side and David Silva taps in to give them the lead in under sixty seconds! Advertisement 1 2 3 4 5 Next

Our prediction

Manchester City to hit back after faltering last week. Man City 4-1 Watford.

When is it?

The game kicks off at 3pm on Saturday September 21.
